content: Show Push Notifications on salesforce
title: Push Notifications on salesforce screen

content: Â
title: Push Notifications on salesforce screen

content: Have you ever thought on how we can show Push Notifications on salesforce screen?ğŸ¤”ğŸ¤”ğŸ¤”It is a great way to alert your salesforce users about anything which needs immediate attention. And It may not be as complex as you think!ğŸª„ğŸ””ğŸ“² Lets break this up in to 2 steps:ğŸª›
title: Push Notifications on salesforce screen

content: Create a Custom Notification TypeğŸ‘‰Go to Setup > Notification Builder > Custom Notifications . Create a new Custom Notification Type by giving name and supported channels(Desktop/Mobile)
title: Push Notifications on salesforce screen

content: Trigger the notificationğŸ‘‰you can trigger notifications from APEX or Flows
title: Push Notifications on salesforce screen

content: ğŸŸ¢From FlowYou can use Action element->select Action â€˜Send Custom Notificationâ€™ and pass in the needed details like : - ğ˜Šğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜® ğ˜•ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯ ğ˜›ğ˜ºğ˜±ğ˜¦ ğ˜ğ˜¥ - Record Id of Custom Notification Type- ğ˜•ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯ ğ˜›ğ˜ªğ˜µğ˜­ğ˜¦ - Title for your notification- ğ˜Šğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜® ğ˜•ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯ ğ˜”ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜´ğ˜¢ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ - Message you want to show in Notification- ğ˜™ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜ªğ˜±ğ˜ªğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µ ğ˜ğ˜‹ğ˜´ - A variable of type text with multiple values allowed- ğ˜›ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µ ğ˜ğ˜‹ - The record you need to open on clicking the push notification etcHere are few screenshots to understand this better:
title: Push Notifications on salesforce screen

content: ğŸŸ¢From ApexYou can use CustomNotification class to create a push notification as below. Apex ğ˜”ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜´ğ˜¢ğ˜¨ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜¨.ğ˜Šğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜•ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯ ğ˜¯ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯ = ğ˜¯ğ˜¦ğ˜¸ ğ˜”ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜´ğ˜¢ğ˜¨ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜¨.ğ˜Šğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜•ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯();ğ˜¯ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯.ğ˜´ğ˜¦ğ˜µğ˜›ğ˜ªğ˜µğ˜­ğ˜¦('ğ˜ˆğ˜±ğ˜¦ğ˜¹ ğ˜Šğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜® ğ˜•ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯');ğ˜¯ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯.ğ˜´ğ˜¦ğ˜µğ˜‰ğ˜°ğ˜¥ğ˜º('ğ˜›ğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜¯ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯ğ˜´ ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ ğ˜¤ğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜¨ ğ˜§ğ˜³ğ˜°ğ˜® ğ˜ğ˜•ğ˜šğ˜ğ˜‹ğ˜Œ ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜ˆğ˜±ğ˜¦ğ˜¹!');ğ˜¯ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯.ğ˜´ğ˜¦ğ˜µğ˜•ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯ğ˜›ğ˜ºğ˜±ğ˜¦ğ˜ğ˜¥(ğ˜¯ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯ğ˜›ğ˜ºğ˜±ğ˜¦.ğ˜ğ˜¥);ğ˜¯ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯.ğ˜´ğ˜¦ğ˜µğ˜›ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µğ˜ğ˜¥(ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µğ˜ğ˜¥);ğ˜¯ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯.ğ˜´ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜¥(ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜ªğ˜±ğ˜ªğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜´ğ˜ğ˜¥ğ˜´); please note this is rough code for understanding ,see the below Screenshot for exact code: ğŸ”— ğŸ”—Here is the link to SF documentation on CustomNotification Class ğŸ”— Here is a nice article on the same from SF Ben This Content was originally posted in linkedin View Post
title: Push Notifications on salesforce screen

content: Populate Lookups Using External Id
title: Populate Lookups Using External Id from APIs

content: Â We all might have used External id field, which is useful when we need to identify records uniquely based on an external system identifiers. We can use these fields while creating or updating records to avoid creating any duplicates in normal scenarios.
title: Populate Lookups Using External Id from APIs

content: Did you know that you can use the same external id field to populate lookupsâ—That is, an external field on parent object can be used to populate the relation when creating/updating a child object record from API. Lets break this down by an example: ğŸ‘‰Lets assume i have 2 objects ğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤ and ğ˜Šğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¥ğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤ related by a lookup relationship. ğŸ‘‰ğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤ has an external Id field "ğ˜šğ˜¶ğ˜£ğ˜šğ˜ºğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜®ğ˜ğ˜¥__ğ˜¤" which hold Id from an external system. ğŸ‘‰I have a ğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤ record with Name=â€œğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µ001â€ and ğ˜šğ˜¶ğ˜£ğ˜šğ˜ºğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜®ğ˜ğ˜¥__ğ˜¤=â€œğ˜Œğ˜Ÿğ˜›ğ˜šğ˜š1â€ My objective is to create a new record of ğ˜Šğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¥ğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤ with parent as record â€œğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µ001â€. Normally we would use Id of parent record to populate this relationship.But mostly this salesforce id may not be available for External system. That is when we can use ğ˜šğ˜¶ğ˜£ğ˜šğ˜ºğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜®ğ˜ğ˜¥ ,External Id field from parent to populate the â€œğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜³â€ relationship on child!âœ… ğŸ‘‰This can be used for update using patch method as well Endpoint : /ğ˜´ğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜·ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¦ğ˜´/ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢/ğ˜·60.0/ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µğ˜´/ğ˜Šğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¥ğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤ Method: ğ˜—ğ˜°ğ˜´ğ˜µ Body: Json { "ğ˜•ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦":"ğ˜Šğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¥ğ˜™ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¥001", "ğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜³": { "ğ˜šğ˜¶ğ˜£ğ˜šğ˜ºğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜®ğ˜ğ˜¥__ğ˜¤":"ğ˜Œğ˜Ÿğ˜›ğ˜šğ˜š1" } }Below is a demo of the same with the help of Salesforce Rest Explorer VS Code Extension!ğŸ©ğŸª„ watch demo video on linkedin SF documentation on Relating Records by Using an External ID in Apex This Content was originally posted in linkedin View Post
title: Populate Lookups Using External Id from APIs

title: Import Files Using Bulk API from Salesforce CLI

content: You can now use the power of Bulk API to ğ¢ğ¦ğ©ğ¨ğ«ğ­ ğš ğ¥ğšğ«ğ ğ ğ§ğ®ğ¦ğ›ğğ« ğ¨ğŸ ğ«ğğœğ¨ğ«ğğ¬ ğ¢ğ§ğ­ğ¨ ğš ğ’ğšğ¥ğğ¬ğŸğ¨ğ«ğœğ ğ¨ğ›ğ£ğğœğ­ ğŸğ«ğ¨ğ¦ ğš ğœğ¨ğ¦ğ¦ğš-ğ¬ğğ©ğšğ«ğšğ­ğğ ğ¯ğšğ¥ğ®ğğ¬ (ğ‚ğ’ğ•) ğŸğ¢ğ¥ğ with the new data import bulk command ğŸ’ª.ğŸ“¢ğŸ“¢ğŸ“¢ Update sf cli to the latest version to use this(## 2.64.6 (October 30, 2024) [stable]).All the records on the csv file should be same Salesforce object Use the --ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ flag to specify the Salesforce object. ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢ ğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µ ğ˜£ğ˜¶ğ˜­ğ˜¬ --ğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¦ <ğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¦ ğ˜¯ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦> --ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ <ğ˜´ğ˜¶ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜ˆğ˜—ğ˜ ğ˜•ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦> --ğ˜¸ğ˜¢ğ˜ªğ˜µ <ğ˜¸ğ˜¢ğ˜ªğ˜µ ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜¦ ğ˜ªğ˜¯ ğ˜®ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜¶ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜´> --ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µ-ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¨ <ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¨ ğ˜¢ğ˜­ğ˜ªğ˜¢ğ˜´> ğŸ‘‰For example, Below command imports Account records from the **accounts.csv88 file into an org with alias â€œmy-scratchâ€: ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢ ğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µ ğ˜£ğ˜¶ğ˜­ğ˜¬ --ğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¦ ğ˜¢ğ˜¤ğ˜¤ğ˜°ğ˜¶ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜´.ğ˜¤ğ˜´ğ˜· --ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜ˆğ˜¤ğ˜¤ğ˜°ğ˜¶ğ˜¯ğ˜µ --ğ˜¸ğ˜¢ğ˜ªğ˜µ 10 --ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µ-ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¨ ğ˜®ğ˜º-ğ˜´ğ˜¤ğ˜³ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¤ğ˜© Thats AllğŸª„ğŸª„ğŸª„ SF CLI Takes care of the rest!ğŸ§™âœ¨ ğŸ‘‰As Bulk imports takes time depending on how many records are in the CSV file the command time out after the specified wait time (10 minutes above).in this case it displays a job ID that you can pass to the new data import resume command to see the status and results of the original export. ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢ ğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µ ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜¶ğ˜®ğ˜¦ --ğ˜«ğ˜°ğ˜£-ğ˜ªğ˜¥ <ğ˜‘ğ˜°ğ˜£ ğ˜ğ˜¥> Resume the most recently run bulk import job for an org with alias my-scratch: ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢ ğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µ ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜¶ğ˜®ğ˜¦ --ğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜¦-ğ˜®ğ˜°ğ˜´ğ˜µ-ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µ --ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µ-ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¨ ğ˜®ğ˜º-ğ˜´ğ˜¤ğ˜³ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¤ğ˜© ğŸ“Here is a quick demo on the same, the data is queried before and after running the command to verify the records are inserted. watch demo video on linkedin SF documentation on data import bulk SF documentation on Prepare Data to Ingest. That is creating csv file for data import. This Content was originally posted in linkedin View Post
title: Import Files Using Bulk API from Salesforce CLI

content: Manage Your Flows More Efficiently with the Automation Lightning App
title: Transfer Records Using SF CLI Commandâ—

content: Â
title: Transfer Records Using SF CLI Commandâ—

content: What Is the easiest way to transfer few records and child records between two sandboxes/orgsâ“Definitely it is using SF CLI command 'ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢ ğ˜¦ğ˜¹ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µ ğ˜µğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¦' and 'ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢ ğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µ ğ˜µğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¦'!ğŸª„ Well, How Exactlyâ“â“â“ Lets say, we want to move few records of ParentObject__c and all related child records ChildObject__c from one sandbox to other.ğŸ“² Lets break this down to 2 steps! 1ï¸âƒ£ ğ„ğ±ğ©ğ¨ğ«ğ­ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğƒğšğ­ğš ğŸğ«ğ¨ğ¦ ğ¬ğ¨ğ®ğ«ğœğ ğ¨ğ«ğ  ğšğ¬ ğ‰ğ’ğğ ğ…ğ¢ğ¥ğğ¬: Open the terminal run the ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢ ğ˜¦ğ˜¹ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µ ğ˜µğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¦ command as below: ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢ ğ˜¦ğ˜¹ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µ ğ˜µğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¦ --ğ˜²ğ˜¶ğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜º "ğ˜šğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜ğ˜¥,ğ˜•ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦,(ğ˜šğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜ğ˜¥,ğ˜•ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦ ğ˜§ğ˜³ğ˜°ğ˜® Cğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¥ğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜³) ğ˜§ğ˜³ğ˜°ğ˜® ğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤" --ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µ-ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¨ <ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜¶ğ˜³ğ˜¤ğ˜¦ ğ˜–ğ˜³ğ˜¨> A JSON File will be created in the root directory with the name â€œğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤-ğ˜Šğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¥ğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤.ğ˜«ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜¯â€ 2ï¸âƒ£ ğˆğ¦ğ©ğ¨ğ«ğ­ ğ‰ğ’ğğ ğƒğšğ­ğš ğ­ğ¨ ğ“ğšğ«ğ ğğ­ ğğ«ğ : Now you can import it to your new org using the command ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¢ ğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜±ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜µ ğ˜µğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¦ --ğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¦ğ˜´ ğ˜—ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤-ğ˜Šğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜­ğ˜¥ğ˜–ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ__ğ˜¤.ğ˜«ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜¯ --ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µ-ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¨ <ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µ ğ˜–ğ˜³ğ˜¨> You can import multiple files by giving filenames comma separated in --files flag.For Eg --files file1.json,file2.json Tada! Done!ğŸª„ğŸª„ğŸª„ Here is a quick demo on the same watch demo video on linkedin SF documentation on data export tree says, The SOQL query can return a maximum of 2,000 records. But I was able to retrieve 10000 records from an org and was able to get even more records(20000) by setting â€œmaxQueryLimitâ€ in sfdx config file. Still i think it would be safe if we stick to 2000 count ğŸŸ¥ Remember! You should have sf cli installed! The objects and fields is expected in target org as source org Include all required fields in the query while running export command or you will get Required field missing error while importing data in target org There is a very interesting flag --plan which we will discuss in another postâ— Do Check Salesforce Documentation on data export tree and data import tree This Content was originally posted in linkedin View Post
title: Transfer Records Using SF CLI Commandâ—

title: Get Complete List Of Objects Using SF CLI CommandğŸ“ğŸ“ğŸ“

title: Get Complete List Of Objects Using SF CLI CommandğŸ“ğŸ“ğŸ“

content: Suppose you need to get the list of all objects on your org or a list of Custom objects or Standard objects separatelyğŸ“•ğŸ“—ğŸ“ƒ.
title: Get Complete List Of Objects Using SF CLI CommandğŸ“ğŸ“ğŸ“

content: What is the approach you will go forâ“wait a minute to think! ğŸ•“ğŸ••ğŸ•š The easiest way would be using 'ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜­ğ˜ªğ˜´ğ˜µ' command in SF CLI!ğŸ—¿ğŸš€ ğŸ‘‰use flag '--ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ' to get all|custom|standard objects Eg: ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜­ğ˜ªğ˜´ğ˜µ --ğ˜´ğ˜¶ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜¤ğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜® ğŸ‘‰use '-ğ˜°' or '--ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜¦ğ˜µ-ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¨' optionally. This will be needed if you run the command out of sfdx project structure or no default org is selected or you want list from a non defaulted org ğŸ‘‰going a step forward, if you need to get this in a csv file, add > <filename>.csv in the commandğŸ”®ğŸª„ For Eg: ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜­ğ˜ªğ˜´ğ˜µ --ğ˜´ğ˜¶ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜¤ğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜® > ğ˜¤ğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µğ˜´.ğ˜¤ğ˜´ğ˜· or ğ˜´ğ˜§ ğ˜´ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜­ğ˜ªğ˜´ğ˜µ --ğ˜´ğ˜¶ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µ ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜¯ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¥ > ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜¯ğ˜¥ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¥ğ˜°ğ˜£ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¤ğ˜µğ˜´.ğ˜¤ğ˜´ğ˜·

content: Exploring HTTP head method
title: Exploring the Lesser-Known HTTP Method: HEAD ğŸŒ

content: Â
title: Exploring the Lesser-Known HTTP Method: HEAD ğŸŒ

content: As Salesforce developers, weâ€™re all well-acquainted with GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE requests. But thereâ€™s one method in the HTTP family that often goes unnoticed: the HEAD method. ğŸ•µï¸â€â™‚ï¸What is the HEAD method? Think of it as GETâ€™s efficient sibling. When you make a HEAD request, youâ€™re essentially asking for the headers only, without the response body. This makes it perfect for: ğŸ‘‰ Checking resource availability: Quick and light! Want to see if a resource is there without fetching the whole payload? HEAD has your back. ğŸ‘‰ Optimizing performance: By skipping the body, you reduce data usage and improve speed, especially handy for resource-heavy content. ğŸ‘‰Update cached resources: To Check if a resource has been modified, if not reuse the local copy otherwise GET the resource again. ğŸ‘‰ Testing and debugging: Need to confirm headers (like Content-Type, Content-Length, or cache headers) before committing to a full request? HEAD can verify those without the wait. Why isnâ€™t it used more often? Since HEAD doesnâ€™t pull in the actual content, itâ€™s commonly skipped in favor of GET. But in scenarios where data isnâ€™t necessary or a quick availability check is all you need, HEAD is the right thing to use! It may be not used as others in the room, but HEAD can improve your API efficiency and reduce unnecessary data transfer. Have you used the HEAD method in your work? Share your experiences below! ğŸ‘‡ This Content was originally posted in linkedin View Post
title: Exploring the Lesser-Known HTTP Method: HEAD ğŸŒ

content: Manage Your Flows More Efficiently with the Automation Lightning App
title: New Automation Lightning App in Salesforceâš¡âš¡âš¡

content: Â
title: New Automation Lightning App in Salesforceâš¡âš¡âš¡

content: ğŸ“±Have you noticed a New â€˜ğ˜ˆğ˜¶ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯â€™ App in salesforce that came with Summer 24 release???.This lightning app aims a better way to manage the flows more efficiently!âš¡ ğŸ’¡You can grant access to this application for other users. title: Custom Label As A Property In Lightning Page & LWR SiteğŸ”–ğŸ”–ğŸ”–

content: Did you know that we can use Custom labels as Property input values in Lightning App BuilderUsing this format {!$ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­.ğ˜Šğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜•ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦}. Probably Yes, as we all have seen the help text on property editor in builder! ğŸ”– But lets say what if we want to the same in an LWR SiteğŸ’¡. We can make it work by adding the default namespace(â€˜câ€™) to it and note, you dont need $ - {!ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­.ğ˜¯ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜±ğ˜¢ğ˜¤ğ˜¦.ğ˜Šğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜•ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦} For Eg: {!ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­.c.MyLabel} Where ğŒğ²ğ‹ğšğ›ğğ¥ is my custom label Name Here is the custom label i have created in my developer edition orgğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» This is how we can reference the Custom Label {!ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­.c.MyLabel} in Lightning App Builder This is how we can reference the Custom Label {!ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­.c.MyLabel} in LWR Site! âš  As mentioned above I have tried this in LWR site and its working perfectly, but not working in aura sites for reasons I am unaware ofâ—ğŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸ Bonus Tip ğŸ¯: You can set the default attribute of property in XML file as {!$ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­.ğ˜Šğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜•ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦} For Eg: <ğ˜±ğ˜³ğ˜°ğ˜±ğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜µğ˜º ğ˜µğ˜ºğ˜±ğ˜¦="ğ˜šğ˜µğ˜³ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜¨" ğ˜¯ğ˜¢ğ˜®ğ˜¦="ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜±ğ˜¶ğ˜µ" ğ˜­ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­="ğ˜ğ˜¯ğ˜±ğ˜¶ğ˜µğ˜›ğ˜¦ğ˜¹ğ˜µ" ğ˜¥ğ˜¦ğ˜§ğ˜¢ğ˜¶ğ˜­ğ˜µ={!$ğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­.ğ˜”ğ˜ºğ˜“ğ˜¢ğ˜£ğ˜¦ğ˜­}" /> Where ğŒğ²ğ‹ğšğ›ğğ¥ is my Custom Label Name This way the value stored in Custom label is taken as default value and you donâ€™t have to change this in code each and every time!ğŸš€ You can find the code for LWC components used in my github repo LWC Component Name : labelInputComponent This Content was originally posted in linkedin View Post
